snippet: Sales growth slowed as consumers spent less in an economy struggling with wavering consumer confidence and unemployment.
abstract: Thomson Reuters survey of 18 retailers finds sales at stores open more than a year rose 2.5 percent in June, compared with 7.7 percent increase in June 2011; shoppers are holding back amid wavering consumer confidence and unemployment.
lead_paragraph: Sales growth slowed as consumers spent less in an economy struggling with wavering consumer confidence and unemployment.

headline.seo: Growth in Retail Sales Slower Than Last Year
headline.main: Growth in Retail Sales Slows From Last Year’s Numbers
headline.print_headline: Growth in Retail Sales Slows From Last Year’s Numbers
